title: Probabilistic Combat System
description: Replace simple combat with GalaxyNG formulas. Attack strength = weapons_mass × weapons_tech. Defence = (shield×shield_tech/(mass+cargo)^(1/3))×30^(1/3). Kill probability = (log4(attack/defence)+1)/2. Round-by-round combat.

title: Race System and Technology Trees
description:
Implement the race entity and technology advancement system.

**Requirements:**
- Race entity with unique identifier and home planet
- Three technology types: Drive, Weapon, Shield
- Technology advancement mechanics (effort proportional to planet size)
- Per-planet technology assignment
- Technology level tracking per race

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- Race struct with technology levels (drive, weapon, shield)
- Technology advancement calculation based on planet size
- Ability to assign technology focus per planet
- Technology level affects ship capabilities
close_reason: Implemented race system with three-tier technology advancement (Drive/Weapon/Shield) and per-planet research

title: Core Game State: Galaxy and Planet System
description:
Implement the core data structures for the galaxy simulation.

**Requirements:**
- Galaxy structure to hold all planets and races
- Planet entity with size (10-300 units), owner, and position
- Initial planet setup: home planets size 100 units
- Random planet size generation for non-home planets
- Material production proportional to planet size

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- Planet struct with size, owner, material production
- Galaxy struct to manage collection of planets
- Random planet generation within size constraints
- Material accumulation per turn per planet
close_reason: Implemented core galaxy and planet system with material production

title: Space Exploration and Travel System
description:
Implement ship movement and planet exploration mechanics.

**Requirements:**
- Ship travel orders from planet to planet
- Travel time based on ship engine/drive technology
- Ship arrival detection
- Colony establishment on uninhabited planets
- Exploration state tracking (unexplored vs discovered planets)

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- Ship movement system with origin and destination
- Travel time calculation based on distance and drive tech
- Automatic colonization of uninhabited planets on arrival
- Planet exploration state management
close_reason: Implemented ship travel, colonization, and movement processing

title: Planet Resources and Production System
description: Add resource values (0.01-10.00) to planets. Materials production = resources × production. Capital production requires materials (1 cap = 5 prod + 1 mat). Ship building requires materials (1 mass = 1 material). Add stockpiles for colonists/capital/materials.
close_reason: Resource-based production complete: Materials/Capital formulas, auto-material generation, 3 new tests, 25 total passing

title: Racebot AI Decision System
description:
Create automated AI (racebot) to drive race decisions during simulation. Should make intelligent choices about production, ship building, movement, and combat.

Core capabilities:
- Analyze current game state (planets, ships, threats)
- Make production decisions (Materials/Capital/Research/Ships)
- Build appropriate ships based on strategy
- Direct ship movement (colonization, defense, attack)
- Manage resources and stockpiles

Foundation for behavioral personalities (Aggressive, Defensive, Expansionist, etc).

Testing: Can run multiple racebots in simulation for automated testing.

title: GalaxyNG Ship Formulas
description: Implement correct GalaxyNG formulas: Ship mass = D + W + S + C + (attacks-1)×W/2. Speed = 20×drive_tech×(drive_mass/(ship_mass+cargo)). Update ship design to use attacks count correctly.

title: Bevy Integration and Rendering
description:
Integrate game logic with Bevy game engine and implement basic visualization.

**Requirements:**
- Set up Bevy app structure with ECS
- Map game entities to Bevy entities/components
- Basic rendering of planets, ships, and galaxy
- UI for game state display
- Input handling for player commands
- Visual feedback for combat and exploration

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- Bevy app successfully runs simulation
- Planets rendered in 2D/3D space
- Ships rendered and animated during travel
- UI shows race stats, technology levels
- Combat visually represented
- Turn advancement controls
close_reason: Bevy rendering complete: planets, ships, UI, turn controls, all quality gates passing

title: Ship Design and Construction System
description:
Implement ship building mechanics with three component design.

**Requirements:**
- Ship entity with three components: hull, engine, weapons
- Material cost calculation based on ship design
- Hull determines damage absorption capacity
- Engine determines travel speed (affected by drive tech)
- Phase cannons (0 or more) determine attack power (affected by weapon tech)
- Shield component (affected by shield tech)
- Ship construction from planet materials

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- Ship struct with hull, engine, weapon components
- Material cost calculation for each component
- Ship construction queue system per planet
- Component stats affected by race technology levels
close_reason: Implemented ship design system with hull/engine/weapons and material-based construction

title: Population and Industry System
description: Implement GalaxyNG population/industry model: Population grows 8% per turn (capped by planet size), Industry ≤ Population, Production = Industry + (Pop-Ind)/4, Capital needed to increase industry, Excess population becomes colonists (8:1 ratio)
close_reason: Population/industry system complete with 8% growth, stockpiles, production formula, 5 tests

title: Turn-Based Simulation Engine
description:
Implement the core turn-based game loop.

**Requirements:**
- Turn processing system
- Per-turn material production on planets
- Per-turn technology advancement
- Ship movement processing
- Combat resolution per turn
- Victory condition checking (most planets)

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- Turn counter and advance mechanism
- Process all planets for production and tech
- Process all ships for movement
- Process all encounters/combat
- Check victory conditions
- End game when victory achieved
close_reason: Turn engine complete: advance_turn() with all subsystems, run_simulation() with victory detection

title: Game Initialization System
description:
Implement game setup and initial state generation.

**Requirements:**
- Configure galaxy size and planet count
- Configure initial race count
- Random placement of race home planets (size 100)
- Random generation of unoccupied planets (size 10-300)
- Initialize race starting technology levels
- Ensure home planets are distributed across galaxy

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- Game initialization with parameters (races, planets, space size)
- Random but valid initial state generation
- Each race starts with one home planet (size 100)
- Remaining planets randomly sized (10-300)
- All planets positioned in game space
close_reason: Implemented random galaxy generator with configurable parameters and unique race names

title: Racebot Integration and Testing
description:
Integrate racebot with game loop and create comprehensive tests:

Integration:
- Hook racebot into turn processing for AI-controlled races
- Multi-racebot simulation support (multiple AI races in one game)
- Observable behavior (logging, statistics, decision tracking)

Testing:
- Unit tests for individual decision functions
- Integration tests with multiple racebots competing
- Verify different personalities produce distinct outcomes
- Performance testing (simulate 100+ turns with multiple AIs)
- Regression tests for AI behavior consistency

Examples:
- 4-race free-for-all with different personalities
- Aggressive vs Defensive matchup
- Economic race building empire while others fight

Depends on: galaxy-6pc, galaxy-tij

title: Race Relationships and Diplomacy
description:
Implement three-state relationship system between races.

**Requirements:**
- Relationship states: Friendly, Hostile, Neutral
- Default relationship initialization
- Relationship tracking between all race pairs
- Automatic hostile relationship on attack
- Relationship-based encounter behavior

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- Relationship enum (Friendly/Hostile/Neutral)
- Relationship matrix between races
- Auto-escalation to Hostile when attacked
- Relationship affects ship encounter outcomes
close_reason: Implemented three-state diplomacy system with relationship tracking and auto-escalation

title: Combat System
description:
Implement ship-to-ship and ship-to-planet combat mechanics.

**Requirements:**
- Combat triggered when hostile ships encounter
- Attack calculations using phase cannons vs shields
- Damage calculation and ship destruction
- Defensive ship behavior (counter-attack)
- Planet defense mechanics

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- Combat resolution system
- Damage calculation: weapon power vs shield/hull
- Ship destruction when hull depleted
- Auto-retaliation for attacked ships
- Combat affects relationship status
close_reason: Implemented simultaneous combat resolution with auto-escalation and ship destruction

title: Planet Bombing and Capture
description: Ships with weapons bomb enemy planets reducing population/industry by 75%. Winner captures planet. Unowned planet if standoff. Bombing triggers capital production.

title: Racebot Behavioral Personalities
description:
Implement different AI personalities that change how racebot behaves:

Personalities:
- **Aggressive**: Prioritizes warship production, seeks combat, attacks readily
- **Defensive**: Builds defensive ships, stays near home, focuses on fortifying
- **Expansionist**: Builds scouts/colony ships, explores aggressively, rapid colonization
- **Economic**: Focuses on production (Materials/Capital), research, infrastructure
- **Balanced**: Mix of all strategies, adapts to situation

Implementation:
- PersonalityTrait enum
- Personality influences: production priorities, ship design choices, movement strategy, combat willingness
- Each personality has weighted decision parameters

Testing: Run simulation with different personalities, observe distinct behaviors

Depends on: galaxy-6pc (core racebot system)

title: Cargo System
description: Ships carry colonists/capital/materials. Cargo capacity = cargo_mass + cargo_mass²/10. Cargo tech increases capacity. Load/unload at planets. Effective cargo for speed calculations.
